eg.syntax

Class SyntaxSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.syntax.SyntaxSearch

  • public class SyntaxSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    The search and coloring of different syntax elements

      • SyntaxSearch

        public SyntaxSearch(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument doc,
                    javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet normalSet)
        Parameters:
        doc - the StyledDocument that contains the text to color
        normalSet - the SimpleAttributeSet that has the normal attributes, that is black and plain

    • Method Detail

      • setColorable

        public void setColorable(Colorable colorable)
        Sets a Colorable that uses this methods to color syntax elements. If null the text is not colored or any coloring is removed if a Colorable had been set before
        Parameters:
        colorable - a Colorable object

      • color

        public void color(java.lang.String text,
                  java.lang.String toColor,
                  int pos,
                  int posStart)
        Colors text in this document using this Colorable.
        Parameters:
        text - the entire text in the document
        toColor - the line (or multiline section) that is colored. Equals text to scan the entire text
        pos - the position where a change happened.
        posStart - the position where toColor starts

      • setCharAttrBlack

        public void setCharAttrBlack()
        (Re-)colors this section of text that is to be colored in black and (re-)sets any characters shown in bold to plain

      • keywordsRed

        public void keywordsRed(java.lang.String[] keys,
                        boolean reqWord)
        Searches keywords for coloring in red. If the boolean reqWord is true coloring requires that a keyword does not adjoin to a letter or a digit.
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - if coloring requires that the keyword is a word

      • keywordsRedBold

        public void keywordsRedBold(java.lang.String[] keys,
                            boolean reqWord)
        Searches keywords for coloring in red and displaying in bold. If the boolean reqWord is true coloring requires that a keyword does not adjoin to a letter or a digit.
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - if coloring requires that the keyword is a word

      • keywordsBlue

        public void keywordsBlue(java.lang.String[] keys,
                         boolean reqWord)
        Searches keywords for coloring in blue. If the boolean reqWord is true coloring requires that a keyword does not adjoin to a letter or a digit.
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - if coloring requires that the keyword is a word

      • keywordsRed

        public void keywordsRed(java.lang.String[] keys,
                        char[] nonWordStart,
                        boolean inBraces)
        Searches keywords for coloring in red. Coloring requires that a keyword does not adjoin to a letter or digit and, in addition, is not preceded with a character in nonWordStart. The boolean inBraces indicates that the keyword must be found in region that follows an opening brace (if true) or is outside a region in braces (if false).
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that do not precede colored a keyword. Can be null
        inBraces - if coloring requires that a keyword is inside or outside a region in braces

      • keywordsBlue

        public void keywordsBlue(java.lang.String[] keys,
                         char[] nonWordStart,
                         boolean inBraces)
        Searches keywords for coloring in blue. Coloring requires that a keyword does not adjoin to a letter or digit and, in addition, is not preceded with a character in nonWordStart. The boolean inBraces indicates that the keyword must be found in region that follows an opening brace (if true) or is outside a region in braces (if false).
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that do not precede colored a keyword. Can be null
        inBraces - if coloring requires that a keyword is inside or outside a region in braces

      • signedVariables

        public void signedVariables(char[] startChars,
                            char[] endChars)
        Searches variables that start with one of the characters in startChars and end with one of the characters in endChars. The variables are colored in purple
        Parameters:
        startChars - the array start characters
        endChars - the array of end characters

      • signedVariablesBlue

        public void signedVariablesBlue(char[] startChars,
                                char[] endChars,
                                boolean inBraces)
        Searches variables that start with one of the characters in startChars and end with one of the characters in endChars. The boolean inBraces indicates that the keyword must be found in region that follows an opening brace (true) or is outside a region in braces (false). The variables are colored in red.
        Parameters:
        startChars - the array start characters
        endChars - the array of end characters
        inBraces - if coloring requires that a keyword is inside or outside a region in braces

      • htmlTags

        public void htmlTags(java.lang.String[] tags,
                     java.lang.String[] attributes)
        Searches and colors html tags with attributes. Tags are colored in blue, atrributes in red and attribute values in purple
        Parameters:
        tags - the array of tags
        attributes - the array of attributes

      • embedInHtml

        public void embedInHtml(Colorable colTemp,
                        java.lang.String startTag,
                        java.lang.String endTag)
        Colors sections embedded in a html document by setting a temporary Colorable (for a javascript or css). The specified strings mark the start and end tags for the embedded sections
        Parameters:
        colTemp - the Colorable
        startTag - the start tag
        endTag - the end tag

      • bracesGray

        public void bracesGray()
        Searches braces for coloring in gray and displaying in bold

      • bracketsBlue

        public void bracketsBlue()
        Searches brackets for coloring in blue and displaying in bold

      • quotedText

        public void quotedText()
        Searches quoted text for coloring in orange. The quote mark is ignored if a backslash precedes it. This method must not be used for html and must be called after the methods that search for keywords, braces and brackets.

      • lineComments

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String lineCmnt,
                         char[] notCmntStart)
        Searches line comments for coloring in green
        Parameters:
        lineCmnt - the string that marks the start of a line comment
        notCmntStart - the array of characters that disable coloring if these precede lineCmt. Can be null.

      • blockComments

        public void blockComments(java.lang.String blockStart,
                          java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Searches block comments for coloring in green
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the start of a block
        blockEnd - the end of a block

      • isInBlock

        public boolean isInBlock(java.lang.String blockStart,
                         java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Returns the boolean that indicates if this position where a change happened is found in a block of text that is delimited by the specified strings blockStart and blockEnd
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the block start
        blockEnd - the block end
        Returns:
        the boolean value
